radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bilateral lower lobe dependent atelectasis; scattered coronary artery calcifications; dilated retrocecal appendix to 16 mm with surrounding fat stranding; mild wall thickening within the cecum; no focal liver lesions; no intra or extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation; unremarkable gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach, and small bowel; no free fluid or free air in abdomen; normal-sized abdominal aorta; scattered aortic and bilateral iliac artery calcifications; noncalcified atheromatous disease in aorta and left common iliac artery; unremarkable bladder; no free fluid or pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in pelvis; no osseous lesions concerning for infection or malignancy; multilevel degenerative changes in spine.
